articles.headline: As Speaker, Paul Ryan May Need to Pare Lofty Goals
articles.snippet: Mr. Ryan rocketed to political stardom with big plans, but he is likely to settle on modest goals as he seeks to repair the deep fractures in the House Republican caucus.
articles.abstract: Mr. Ryan rocketed to political stardom with big plans, but he is likely to settle on modest goals as he seeks to repair the deep fractures in the House Republican caucus.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Paul D. Ryan, a son and grandson of Midwestern lawyers, ascended rapidly in American politics as a man with big plans: to overhaul the tax code, slash federal spending and rewrite the social contracts for Medicare and Social Security.
articles.byline: By David M. Herszenhorn and Emmarie Huetteman

articles.headline: Express Scripts and CVS Health Cut Ties With a Pharmacy Linked to Valeant
articles.snippet: The nation’s two largest drug benefit managers will cease doing business with Philidor Rx Services, which has been bolstering sales of products made by Valeant.
articles.abstract: The nation’s two largest drug benefit managers will cease doing business with Philidor Rx Services, which has been bolstering sales of products made by Valeant.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s three largest drug benefit managers said on Thursday that they would cease doing business with a mysterious pharmacy that has been bolstering sales of products made by Valeant Pharmaceuticals International.

articles.headline: The Narrative Frays for Theranos and Elizabeth Holmes
articles.snippet: The classic Silicon Valley story of Theranos, the medical test company, has been embraced without the peer review common in medicine.
articles.abstract: The classic Silicon Valley story of Theranos, the medical test company, has been embraced without the peer review common in medicine.
articles.lead_paragraph: Few people, let alone those just 31 years old, have amassed the accolades and riches bestowed on Elizabeth Holmes, founder and chief executive of the blood-testing start-up Theranos.

articles.headline: Fairway Slumps as Epicure Options Grow
articles.snippet: Fairway Market, the grocery chain known for offering exotic foods to affluent shoppers, is struggling and paring back its expansion plans, as food lovers have more choices, both in stores and online.
articles.abstract: Fairway Market, the grocery chain known for offering exotic foods to affluent shoppers, is struggling and paring back its expansion plans, as food lovers have more choices, both in stores and online.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Fairway Market’s grocery store on Manhattan’s Upper East Side, shoppers bustle past a colorful array of squash, peppers and cucumbers. A bulb of fennel or a bright red pomegranate can be picked up for $2.99. The scents of ground fair-trade coffee, pricey imported French cheese and fresh-baked loaves of artisanal bread waft through the store.

articles.headline: Ghostly Transcends Its Record Label Roots to Sell an Ethos
articles.snippet: The label, which began in 1999, has expanded into an online boutique offering items like watches, eyeglasses and art to taste-conscious cultural consumers.
articles.abstract: The label, which began in 1999, has expanded into an online boutique offering items like watches, eyeglasses and art to taste-conscious cultural consumers.
articles.lead_paragraph: At the Ghostly Store, an online boutique, you can buy wristwatches, leather wallets, gallery-quality art prints, coffee beans, notebooks and a special line of Warby Parker eyeglasses. And if you’re interested, you can also buy the latest downloads and vinyl from electronic artists like Gold Panda and Tycho.

articles.headline: Valeant Drops Philidor Mail-Order Pharmacy
articles.snippet: The drug maker had been criticized for recommending Philidor Rx Services because it discouraged the prescription of less-expensive medicines.
articles.abstract: The drug maker had been criticized for recommending Philidor Rx Services because it discouraged the prescription of less-expensive medicines.
articles.lead_paragraph: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International said on Friday that it was ending its relationship with a pharmacy used to bolster sales of some of its expensive drugs. It also said the pharmacy, Philidor Rx Services, would shut down operations as soon as possible.
articles.byline: By Andrew Pollack and David Jolly

articles.headline: Meg Whitman Seeks Reinvention for HP as It Prepares for Split
articles.snippet: When HP splits after a year of planning, what is left will bear little resemblance to the engineering-driven company founded more than 75 years ago.
articles.abstract: When HP splits after a year of planning, what is left will bear little resemblance to the engineering-driven company founded more than 75 years ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO, Calif. — When Meg Whitman, Hewlett-Packard’s chief executive, was preparing to cleave her company in two, she feared reliving a shoe disaster from early in her career.

articles.headline: In Heroin Crisis, White Families Seek Gentler War on Drugs
articles.snippet: With more middle-class families losing children to the drug, forgiveness, not condemnation, is the tone now being struck by many public officials.
articles.abstract: With more middle-class families losing children to the drug, forgiveness, not condemnation, is the tone now being struck by many public officials.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEWTON, N.H. — When Courtney Griffin was using heroin, she lied, disappeared, and stole from her parents to support her $400-a-day habit. Her family paid her debts, never filed a police report and kept her addiction secret — until she was found dead last year of an overdose.

articles.headline: Obama Sends Special Operations Forces to Help Fight ISIS in Syria
articles.snippet: The president announced on Friday that several dozen troops would be deployed to Kurdish-controlled territory for the first open-ended mission by American ground forces in Syria.
articles.abstract: The president announced on Friday that several dozen troops would be deployed to Kurdish-controlled territory for the first open-ended mission by American ground forces in Syria.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama announced on Friday that he had ordered several dozen Special Operations troops into Syria for the first open-ended mission by United States ground forces in that country, deepening American involvement in a war he has tried to avoid for more than four years.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Helene Cooper and David E. Sanger
